sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: Potential for unencrypted sensitive data exposure if initialData is tainted

sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: objectIDLen could lead to buffer overflow if manipulated

sinks.name: TEE_CreatePersistentObject
sinks.reason: initialDataLen could lead to buffer overflow if manipulated

sinks.name: TEE_Free
sinks.reason: Missing input validation could lead to undefined behavior if a tainted pointer is passed.

sinks.name: TEE_GetObjectInfo1
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on TEE_ObjectHandle could lead to memory corruption

sinks.name: TEE_GetObjectInfo1
sinks.reason: Potential for unencrypted output if TEE_ObjectInfo is mishandled or exposed

sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Tainted `len` parameter can lead to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access if not validated.

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Potential unencrypted output to Normal World if dest is shared

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on size parameter could lead to buffer overflow

sinks.name: TEE_MemMove
sinks.reason: Shared memory operations could expose tainted data if src or dest is shared

sinks.name: TEE_OpenPersistentObject
sinks.reason: Potential buffer overflow or out-of-bounds access due to unvalidated objectIDLen

sinks.name: TEE_OpenPersistentObject
sinks.reason: Tainted data could lead to inappropriate sharing permissions if flags allow shared access

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Buffer could be shared with Normal World, leading to exposure of sensitive data.

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be manipulated, leading to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.
